blocks.title: Method of Determination of the Value of I for any Section.

blocks.text: Whilst it is of some importance to know the values of $I$ for the simpler sections, it is often necessary to determine the value of $I$ for any arbitrary section. This is done by considering a small element of the section at a distance from the axis of rotation, and then integrating to find the sum of all such elements. The moment of inertia for the entire section can be determined from the relation $I = \int r^2 \, dA$ (for area) or $I = \int r^2 \, dm$ (for solid); there are two areas or mass of elements.
